oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A new species of Cheiloneurus Westwood (Hymenoptera, Encyrtidae) as a hyperparasitoid of the invasive cotton mealybug, Phenacoccus solenopsis Tinsley, in China
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Li, Zhuomiao
Yao, Tingting
Xu, Zhihong
Meng, Ling
Li, Baoping
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hymenoptera
Phenacoccus solenopsis
invasive species
Encyrtidae
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new species, Cheiloneurus nankingensissp. nov., from Eastern China is described. It is similar to C. arabiacus Hayat but distinct from it in a number of morphological characters. It is a hyperparasitoid with the encyrtid wasp Aenasius arizonensis Girault, 1915 as the primary host and the cotton mealybug Phenacoccus solenopsis Tinsley, 1898 (Hemiptera: Pseudococcidae) as the secondary host. A key to all seven species of Cheiloneurus known from China is presented.
